description:
3 Word Review: “What Kind of Creatures Are We?” by Noam Chomsky - 

Chomsky's argument that human language and cognition are conditioned by biology is briefly unpacked as he traces both the nature of external (E-) and internal (I- / grammar) language facility and the history of thinkers who wrestled with it. Our external language is a phenomenon of our internal (and perhaps universal/biological) grammar. Thick but enlightening.
